modelPlanner

Class RetirementAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • modelPlanner.RetirementAnalyzer

  • public class RetirementAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    Build a simulated retirement projection randomizing returns as per supplied portfolio variability. Generates a random sampling assuming returns from class implementing SimulableRate interface. Object is immutable. A new amortization table with a randomized projection is generated upon every clone or new instance.
    Author:
    Team 11

      Build a new simulated retirement projection using portfolio volatility

    • Constructor Detail

      • RetirementAnalyzer

        public RetirementAnalyzer(double principal,
                          double deposits,
                          double withdrawals,
                          int age,
                          int maxAge,
                          int retirementAge,
                          double inflation,
                          SimulableRate portfolio,
                          boolean assumeReal)
        Build a new simulated retirement projection using portfolio volatility
        Parameters:
        principal - Initial money at currentAge
        deposits - Yearly deposits to make to the account at the end of every year before retirement age
        withdrawals - Yearly withdrawals to make to the account at the end of every year before retirement age. This will always be considered in present day money (i.e. real) If assumeReal is false, this will be adjusted by inflation
        age - User age at present day
        maxAge - Max age to consider in projections. Could be considered user safety margin.
        retirementAge - Age at which user will start withdrawing money every year
        inflation - Constant annualized inflation rate to assume.
        portfolio - Investment portfolio.
        assumeReal - True if calculation is in real terms, i.e. Today's money, this would mean every year deposits and withdrawals increase in nominal terms

      • getProbBrokeAtAge

        public double getProbBrokeAtAge(int age)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Probability of being broke a certain age, calculated with previously built MonteCarlo simulation if Monte Carlo has not been built, one is built using default iterations
        Parameters:
        age - At which user is broke at which user is broke
        Returns:
        Cumulative Probability [0-1] of being broke at the supplied age
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If supplied age is less than currentAge or greater than maxAge

      • getProbBrokeAtAge

        public double getProbBrokeAtAge(double withdrawal,
                                int age)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Probability of being broke a certain age given a withdrawal amount constant in Today's money (real) and assuming retirement starts at present age, calculated with MonteCarlo simulation
        Parameters:
        withdrawal - Yearly withdrawals in real money
        age - Age at which to estimate probability
        Returns:
        Cumulative Probability [0-1] of being broke at the supplied age
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If supplied age is less than currentAge

      • getMaxSafeWithdrawal

        public double getMaxSafeWithdrawal(int age,
                                   double probability)
        Max withdrawal if retiring today achieving cumm probability of being broke uses Illinois Secant method iterating over Montecarlo Simulations.
        IllinoisSolver Reference
        Parameters:
        age - Age to which to calculate probability
        probability - Cumulative probability of being broke at given age
        Returns:
        Maximum yearly withdrawal. If not able to find solution returns -1

      • getProjectionArray

        public RetirementAnalyzer[] getProjectionArray(int iterations)
        Perform MonteCarloSimulation building several random FutureProjections with parameters used when object was constructed Each iteration item in the array is a complete randomized projection of cashflows until broke (i.e. each iteration is a complete amortization table)
        Parameters:
        iterations, - Number of iterations in the MonteCarlo
        Returns:
        FutureProjection[iterations]

        public void buildMonteCarlo()

        Parameters:
        iterations - Number of iterations

      • writeMontecarloOutputCSV

        public void writeMontecarloOutputCSV(java.lang.String filename)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Write CSV file with key analysis result from previously built Monte Carlo simulation if a Monte Carlo has not been built, it builds one using default interations Has the form: "age,mean_principal,min_principal,max_principal,iterations_broke,cumm_prob_broke"
        Parameters:
        filename - string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - For errors writing the file, typically if its open by another program
